thread.title: Cross country: Montclair girls finish second at SEC championships
thread.title_full: Cross country: Montclair girls finish second at SEC championships

title: Cross country: Montclair girls finish second at SEC championships
text:
Cross country: Montclair girls finish second at SEC championships October 8, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 8, 2015, 12:32 AM The Montclair Times Print 
The Montclair High School girls cross country team had three finishers in the overall top 10 and took second place at the Super Essex Conference-American Division championship meet Tuesday afternoon at Brookdale Park. 
The Mounties’ team total of 63 points trailed only Millburn, the defending Essex County champion, who scored 49. 
Senior Juliet Kohli was the Mounties’ top overall finisher, in fifth in a time of 19 minutes, 53.5 seconds. 
She was followed closely be fellow seniors Lia Schattner (ninth, 20:33.0) and Eliza Gentry (10th, 20:55.8). 
Rounding out Montclair’s top five placers were junior Amelia Lufrano (17th, 21:25.8) and senior Zoe McClellan (22nd, 21:49.6). 
In the Colonial Division championship race, the Montclair Kimberley Academy girls placed five of the top six runners to cruise to an easy division title. 
Seniors Kathryn Correia (20:31.4) and Salem Belay (20:48.6) took the race’s top two spots. 
Junior Caylie Privitere (fourth, 21:58.8), sophomore Evelyn Wallace (fifth, 22:05.0) and senior Anne Lemmer (sixth, 23:25.0) followed in short order. 
On the boys’ side, the Montclair Kimberley Academy earned fifth place in a very competitive American Division race, two spots ahead of Montclair High. 
The top local finisher was MKA junior Bill Massey, who took sixth overall in 16:46.7. 
Mountie senior Geoff Minet was his team’s top runner, taking 13th in 17:07.6. 
Other top performers for MKA included sophomore Nick Wilson (15th, 17:11.0), senior Billy Hughes (20th, 17:16.9) and sophomore Matt Petrocelli (33rd, 17:53.6). 
Montclair’s highest-place runners besides Minet were junior Benjamin Cahill (21st, 17:27.8) and sophomore Dale Ross (24th, 17:36.7). 
The Essex County championship season begins with the All-Class Invitational meet on Oct. 17, while the overall county championship meet is scheduled for Oct. 30 at Brookdale Park in Montclair. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
